org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.matching.common.statistics.binning.pojo

Class TemporalElementStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.matching.common.statistics.binning.pojo.TemporalElementStats
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class TemporalElementStats
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Basic statistical information about temporal elements with a certain label. Uses reservoir sampling for bigger amounts of data, so that statistics may only be estimated based on a sample(!)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_NUM_BINS
      Default Number of bins used for temporal estimations

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TemporalElementStats()
      Creates a element statistics object that uses a reservoir sample of default size SimpleElementStats.DEFAULT_SAMPLE_SIZE to compute the statistics All properties will be considered, their type (numerical/categorical) detected automatically (may not work very good).
      TemporalElementStats(int reservoirSampleSize)
      Creates a element statistics object and set the size of the reservoir sample to compute the statistics.
      TemporalElementStats(int reservoirSampleSize, Set<String> numericalProperties, Set<String> categoricalProperties)
      Creates a element statistics object and set the size of the reservoir sample to compute the statistics.
      TemporalElementStats(Set<String> numericalProperties, Set<String> categoricalProperties)
      Creates an element statistics object that uses a reservoir sample of default size.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addElement(TemporalElement element)
      Updates the statistics by adding a new element's data
      Map<String,Map<PropertyValue,Double>> getCategoricalSelectivityEstimation()
      Returns a map that maps categorical property names to estimations of the probability that an element has this property with a certain PropertyValue.
      Long getElementCount()
      Returns the number of elements in the sample
      Binning[] getEstimatedTimeBins()
      Returns the binning estimations for tx_from, tx_to, val_from, val_to depending on the vertices that are currently in the reservoir sample
      String getLabel()
      Returns the label of the elements
      Map<String,Double> getNumericalOccurrenceEstimation()
      Returns a map that maps every numerical property to an estimation of the probability of its occurrence (based on the current reservoir sample)
      Map<String,Double[]> getNumericalPropertyStatsEstimation()
      Returns a map that maps every numerical property to an estimation of its mean and variance based on the current reservoir sample
      List<TemporalElement> getSample()
      Returns the sample
      double[] getTemporalPropertyStats(org.gradoop.gdl.model.comparables.time.TimeSelector.TimeField property)
      Returns the (not binning-based) statistics for temporal properties.

      Return the statistics for tx time durations.

      Return the statistics for valid time durations.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_NUM_BINS

        public static final int DEFAULT_NUM_BINS
        Default Number of bins used for temporal estimations
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • TemporalElementStats

        public TemporalElementStats(int reservoirSampleSize,
                            Set<String> numericalProperties,
                            Set<String> categoricalProperties)
        Creates a element statistics object and set the size of the reservoir sample to compute the statistics. The numerical and categorical properties are set by the user. Omitted properties are ignored, always assigned the probability 0.5
        Parameters:
        reservoirSampleSize - size of reservoir sample
        numericalProperties - list of numerical properties to consider
        categoricalProperties - list of categorical properties to consider

      • TemporalElementStats

        public TemporalElementStats(int reservoirSampleSize)
        Creates a element statistics object and set the size of the reservoir sample to compute the statistics. The numerical and categorical properties are determined automatically later (possibly not working very good), all properties are considered.
        Parameters:
        reservoirSampleSize - size of reservoir sample

      • TemporalElementStats

        public TemporalElementStats()
        Creates a element statistics object that uses a reservoir sample of default size SimpleElementStats.DEFAULT_SAMPLE_SIZE to compute the statistics All properties will be considered, their type (numerical/categorical) detected automatically (may not work very good).

      • TemporalElementStats

        public TemporalElementStats(Set<String> numericalProperties,
                            Set<String> categoricalProperties)
        Creates an element statistics object that uses a reservoir sample of default size. Numerical and categorical properties to consider are given explicitly
        Parameters:
        numericalProperties - numerical properties to consider
        categoricalProperties - categorical properties to consider

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public boolean addElement(TemporalElement element)
        Updates the statistics by adding a new element's data
        Parameters:
        element - the element to include in the stats
        Returns:
        true iff the element was actually included in the reservoir sample

      • getEstimatedTimeBins

        public Binning[] getEstimatedTimeBins()
        Returns the binning estimations for tx_from, tx_to, val_from, val_to depending on the vertices that are currently in the reservoir sample
        Returns:
        binning estimations for temporal data

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel()
        Returns the label of the elements
        Returns:
        label of the elements

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(String label)
        sets the label
        Parameters:
        label - label

      • getNumericalPropertyStatsEstimation

        public Map<String,Double[]> getNumericalPropertyStatsEstimation()
        Returns a map that maps every numerical property to an estimation of its mean and variance based on the current reservoir sample
        Returns:
        map of property names to double arrays. Every array is of the form {mean, variance}.

      • getNumericalOccurrenceEstimation

        public Map<String,Double> getNumericalOccurrenceEstimation()
        Returns a map that maps every numerical property to an estimation of the probability of its occurrence (based on the current reservoir sample)
        Returns:
        map of property name to probability of its occurence

      • getCategoricalSelectivityEstimation

        public Map<String,Map<PropertyValue,Double>> getCategoricalSelectivityEstimation()
        Returns a map that maps categorical property names to estimations of the probability that an element has this property with a certain PropertyValue. The map is only computed on the sample, so that not every possible property value is included!
        Returns:
        map of property name to a map from property values to their estimated selectivity

      • getElementCount

        public Long getElementCount()
        Returns the number of elements in the sample
        Returns:
        number of elements in the sample

      • getTxDurationStats

        public double[] getTxDurationStats()
        Return the statistics for tx time durations. Recomputes all temporal estimations if necessary.
        Returns:
        statistics for tx time durations in the form {mean, variance}

      • getValDurationStats

        public double[] getValDurationStats()
        Return the statistics for valid time durations. Recomputes all temporal estimations if necessary.
        Returns:
        statistics for valid time durations in the form {mean, variance}

      • getSample

        public List<TemporalElement> getSample()
        Returns the sample
        Returns:
        sample

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • getTemporalPropertyStats

        public double[] getTemporalPropertyStats(org.gradoop.gdl.model.comparables.time.TimeSelector.TimeField property)
        Returns the (not binning-based) statistics for temporal properties. They are arrays of the form {mean, variance, prob. that from=TemporalElement.DEFAULT_TIME_FROM / to=TemporalElement.DEFAULT_TIME_TO}
        Parameters:
        property - temporal property
        Returns:
        statistics array for the property
